intro: Kiggelaria, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in southern Africa, where they thrive in rocky and arid environments. The plants are characterized by their woody stems, simple leaves, and small, clustered flowers. They produce edible fruits that are sometimes used in local cuisines. Kiggelaria species are also valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
